oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed on label on front of slide: ''Buchtel Tower with snow, Bldgs 18, c. 1998 University of Denver.''
Exterior view of the University of Denver's Buchtel Tower in Denver, Colorado. Snowy pine tree in the foreground.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Part 2 of the report of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) annual meeting held on May 30-June 2, 1924; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak was the Secretary. Includes 20-year statistical data about patients from 1904-1923, and a report of the Society's expenditures.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) for January-March 1916; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. Includes reports from the New York Ladies' Auxiliary, the St. Louis Ladies' Auxiliary, the Cincinnati Ladies' Auxiliary, the Cleveland Ladies' Auxiliary, the Holyoke Ladies' Auxiliary, the St. Louis Young People's JCRS, the Baltimore Ladies' Auxiliary, and the Tyler Ladies' Auxiliary. Also includes portraits of Ladies' Auxiliary officers.

Physicians
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) sixth annual meeting on March 27, 1910, and its operations and finances for the period beginning January 1, 1909, and ending December 31, 1909; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. The Secretary's report indicates that 298 patients were treated in 1909. Includes images of the facility, statistical data about the patients (including age, occupation, and duration of disease), and a list of all donors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society Records, Publications
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) for March-April 1913 ; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary.
